Summary: Amber, fuzzy, pulsing light (smaller one nearby) which moved, then strobed then stopped and looked like any star.
divs: sighting detailsmy friend ann and i went downtown st. joseph, mi (south of south haven, across the lake from chicago) to see the christmas lights on the bluff. my friend noticed an orange-ish or amber, fuzzy, pulsing light (smaller one nearby) which waxed and waned slowly behind the display\over the lake in the vicinity of chicago, and she wanted to see it better. so we drove down to the beach. i thought it may be a plane circling o'hare going in and out of clouds which would explain the pulsing flare type light, but couldn't understand why it was amber colored. it didn't move but i figured we would be too far away to see the actual circling movement. the smaller was to the right of the big one (more toward milwaukee)and would phase out totally then come back. the big one then started to move toward us, now with white strobe lights (no longer an amber,fuzzy pulsing flare). the smaller one just disappeared. we then drove as fast as we could to the top of the bluff to see it better overhead as it came across. at one point i decided to look under the lights instead of at the lights and thought i saw a humongous cigar shaped object, which struck me with fear, but i can't be sure about that because it was dark against a dark sky and its strobes were bright. it strobed steadily, somewhat slowly, and made no sound whatsoever, over the vicinity of cleveland and hilltop roads in st. joe. then it stopped high in the sky and looked like any star. it "sat" there so long we finally gave up and went home. i was fascinated and alert during the experience and only felt fear when it was overhead and in front of us (when i thought i saw a huge shape). my friend neil also saw it that night, originally from his home's picture window, then from his car. living by lake michigan and liking the beach (day and night), this hasn't been the first unusual thing i've seen. 2) in july or august of 1971 a friend and i saw two white lights (looked like stars) coming from the milwaukee area over the lake at about 11:30 p.m. they bobbed side-by-side as if two pilots were having fun flying, when suddenly they darted across the sky at great speeds and at sharp angles. 3) also, in fall of 1973 at about 9:30 p.m. i was driving down the then-remote west q avenue in mattawan, mi, going toward 8915 west q, and felt i was being followed by an object in the sky (no other cars were around), but thought it just seemed like being followed since they may have been using i-94 (nearby) as a guide. i didn't get creeped out until it was directly over the top of my car with a bright light lighting up my car. can't remember what happened after that. 4) a fourth incident was with my dad and i driving down a freeway on a sunny\totally blue sky day, somewhere in northern indiana (can't remember). we saw a very shiny (sterling silver shiny) silver disc-shaped object hovering in the sky. he saw it but denied it was a ufo, even though it hovered, was not a helicopter, had no wings, and was way above the power lines (he didn't want to have to deal with what he was seeing i guess!) 5) i've never seen anything up really close, but have 3 friends\acquaintances janie and rose (one incident), and roberta (another incident) who did and both said it was the size of a football field. one probably wouldn't talk about it to you (husband thinks she's nuts!) but the other probably would. keep up the investigations...this is for real, have seen enough to know it can't be denied.
Object Flight Path: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path then hovering
